intro: Eriogonum heermannii, commonly known as the Heermann's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features basal leaves that are often gray-green in color and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is well adapted to dry conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, rocky soils. Eriogonum heermannii plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
